summary: Rufo Lopez Fresquet is mentioned in three documents. While the documents do not explicitly detail his role or significance in the JFK assassination context, they provide some context regarding his potential connections and activities within the Cuban exile community during the 1960s. He appears in documents related to anti-Castro activities and individuals involved in these activities. The documents suggest that he was part of a network of individuals and organizations involved in anti-Castro efforts, and his name surfaces in the context of intelligence gathering and Cuban exile politics. However, the specific nature of his involvement and his direct connection to the JFK assassination remain unclear based on the provided documents.
key_connections: Committee for the Liberation of the One Hundred
